intro: Malcolmia patula var. canescens, commonly known as the pale malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
